text:
Elizabeth Hamilton (née Schuyler; August 9, 1757 – November 9, 1854), also called Eliza or Betsey, was a socialite and philanthropist. She was from the wealthy and slave owning Van Rensselaer and Schuyler families. She was married to American founding father Alexander Hamilton.
She was a defender of his works, a mother, and co-founder and deputy director of Graham Windham, the first private orphanage in New York City.
